meta.description: The Qantas Hong Kong Lounge at Hong Kong International Airport (HKG), Terminal 1. Learn more about the lounge: amenities, photos, review, opening hours, location.

lounge.name: The Qantas Hong Kong Lounge

location.terminalDirections: Level 7, above Gate 5, proceed up to the Food Court on Level 7 by the shops

location.description: Chek Lap Kok, Hong Kong, China

lounge.description: Enjoy a new standard of luxury at the Qantas Hong Kong Lounge. Eligible passengers can experience Neil Perry's Spice Temple-inspired dishes and signature cocktails before boarding overnight flights to Australia, maximising sleep once onboard. In partnership with Sofitel, enhanced dining experiences will be available throughout the day, including yum cha trolleys and freshly made classics that reflect the rich cuisine culture of Hong Kong.

reviews.content: First lounge where I’ve had a proper whisky sour. Really enjoyed the amazing cocktail bar. Food was as delicious as the drinks, and service super friendly. Easily accessible from security screening.
Large fresh lounge rarely crowded. Good food and beverage offerings. Just note where your gate is in relationship to the lounge as it might be a very long walk.
Thoughtfully designed space. Not busy on a Mon morning @ 10 am. Spread included JP food (for JL customers). Amazing tarmac views.
Loads of space, airy, great service.
This is an incredible lounge with multiple food and drink options, although I can’t help but feel like it I’m inside a factory at times. The colour scheme is a bit industrial.
Quiet and spacious with comfortable seating and plenty of room to work if needed. Great space!
Excellent amount of space. Just about every seat has a power point or USB nearby. The area with TV are closed when quiet. No announcements for CX flights. You have to check the departure board.
Quite possibly the largest lounge at HKG. Airy and spacious, loads of seating room, great working areas, lots of TVs, good cocktails and hot buffet. Impressed. Aussies do it right.
Nice contrast to Cathay's (superb) lounges with more western style food and Aussie wines. Easy to reach, just turn right after coming out from the right side inspections.
It's a decent size, clean lounge.
Very rude staff, wouldn't honour my status or ticket for a guest that was traveling with me.
Spacious lounge with a great view, decor is modern and very comfortable, food selection limited, but sufficient and quality is excellent, really good spot to relax before flight.
If boarding from Gate 25-ish or lower, the Qantas Hong Kong Lounge is a great alternative to The Wing/The Cabin. Friendly staff, terrific catering, and space so large I can't imagine it gets crowded.
Easily one of the nicest lounges I've visited. Calm atmosphere. Plenty of space. Very good food. Above avg wine selection and a bar that makes real cocktails. Well done Qantas, well done.
Amazing for a business class lounge. In fact, the style/comfort even beats the Cathay First (!). Food options are really solid.
Plenty of space, comfortable, clean, great service, nice food.
Really big and really quiet lounge. If you're looking for somewhere to escape the crowds, this is it. Great seating, food and drink options. Friendly staff. A good alternative when The Wing is busy.
Another one of my favourite lounges in APAC!
Very good lounge overall and second only to Cathay Pacific's The Pier and The Wing lounges. Lots of space, good food, and very good service.
Great alternative to the CX Business Class lounges in HKG. Quality service, great food & drinks, nice clean showers, very friendly staff.
Really impressive, well designed, huge and spacious. Food is very colorful but lacked seasoning and no Asian options when I was there. Worth a detour before going to CX The Wing.
Excellent pork and coffee. Love this spacious place.

Spacious, great views, good food. Feels more like a swanky restaurant/lounge than an airport lounge. No crowds, probably because it's a little hidden and out of the way. Good for some peace and quiet.
Outstanding in design, service, food and drink offerings. Another awesome Qantas Lounge. One of the best OW Business Class Lounges at HKG.
For the food alone, it's worth the walk! Not as cozy as CX The Bridge, but very quiet. WiFi was down so I went to Bridge.
Love this lounge and consider it the best OneWorld Business Lounge at HKG. It is rarely crowded and features outstanding food.
The only thing missing from this lounge is private workstations, but maybe I didn't find them cause the place is absolutely gigantic. Probably the biggest lounge in HKG!
Beautiful wide open space, friendly attentive staff, amazing food options, and plenty of restrooms. #ditchthewing
No words.. My first transit in HK came with high expectations for the Cathay lounges - which were met. But the Qantas lounge beats them hands down. The design is particularly impressive!
Best lounge in HKG (only Cathay's The Wing's 1st class shower cabanas outclass it), go to the bar and have a drink with Ella while enjoying Chef Dani's ?? barbecue, you won't regret it!
New lounge is great. Lots of room and a great bar.
After the QF flights are gone (ie: BA flights only) only the buffet and bar is available but still a very good lounge.

A truly fantastic lounge. Much more comfortable than the CX first lounge. Great restaurant quality food selection, quirky and spacious. Definitely recommend for all Oneworld connections thru Hong Kong.
Excellent lounge in a similar style to the Qantas Singapore Lounge.
Fabulous Australian/Kong Kong inspired new lounge with roving dumpling carts and charsiu BBQ pork. Clean, modern and fashionable design in line with all new QANTAS international lounges. A+
What a great lounge! The environment is relaxed, the service is good, and the food is yummy.
